clinical_study.brief_title: Electronic Patient Reporting of Side Effects to Chemotherapy: A Cluster Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Electronic Patient Reporting of Side Effects to Chemotherapy Among Breast Cancer Patients Using the Patient-Reported Outcomes Version of Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (PRO-CTCAE): A Cluster Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine whether the use of breast cancer patients' own electronic reporting of side effects to chemotherapy in a treatment setting has an impact on the handling of side effects and on the number of hospitalizations, febrile neutropenia and dose adjustments. We are using the Patient-Reported Outcomes version of the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (PRO-CTCAE) for the patients' reporting of side effects.

primary_outcome.measure: Dose adjustments reported in the medication treatment sheet before each cycle of chemotherapy (5 time points with three weeks interval)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 18 weeks of treatment in the period betweeen November 1, 2015 and January 31, 2017

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of hospitalizations reported in the medical record after each of the six cycles of chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 18 weeks of treatment in the period betweeen November 1, 2015 and January 31, 2017

secondary_outcome.measure: Febrile neutropenia reported in the medical record after each of the six cycles of chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 18 weeks of treatment in the period betweeen November 1, 2015 and January 31, 2017

secondary_outcome.measure: Detailed description of side effects in the medical record before start of chemotherapy and after each six cycles of chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 18 weeks of treatment in the period betweeen November 1, 2015 and January 31, 2017

secondary_outcome.measure: Handling of side effects documented in the medical record
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 18 weeks of treatment in the period betweeen November 1, 2015 and January 31, 2017

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients' experience of communication and handling of side effects measured in questionnaire survey and qualitative interviews
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to18 weeks of chemotherapy in the period November 1, 2015 - January 31, 2017

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient and staff compliance as registerede by the software used

arm_group.description: Patients report PRO-CTCAE symptoms on a tablet computer before each cycle of chemotherapy

intervention.intervention_name: Completion of PRO-CTCAE items before consultation
intervention.description: Patients report PRO-CTCAE symptoms on a tablet computer before each cycle of chemotherapy
